ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend taking the class only if that student already has a solid background in film theory. The class is not particularly beginner-friendly, and does not provide any context for the works with which we engaged, but instead pandered more toward a hand-full of theorists whose works fit one particular approach to film theory.
See response 1.a. This is an essential class for film students because key concepts in the field are introduced by a master.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Yes, the deeper exposure to Bazin and his writing compliments my own research on media and its criticism.

Although we only focused on a small number of theorists, those theorists are clearly crucial to the field and have helped me establish a common vocabulary with other academics in the field with which I now feel more comfortable communicating.
This is an "introduction" of sorts so while it won't contribute to my dissertation per se, it will inform my thinking.
